channel.title: Environmental variables
channel.description: Well recently i had my environmental variables working fine, just not with java because it would never recognize the update i had, so i had them set with quicktime player, and i could run private servers, yesterday i was trying to see if i could set them to java, but i forgot to make a copy of the original ones, so if someone could tell me how to fix them, id be really thanked...P.S java environmental variables dont work cuz they wont get recognized...ty

item.title: Environmental variables
item.dc:creator: @Linksbro Linksbro
item.description:
@Linksbro wrote:

Enviroment Varibles = Always have your path on java.

My Guide = Manual way to do it, so you can use CMD for other things then just java.

Oh, if you want to fix your Environment Varibles, you are going to be using them for these things,

Compiling
Running your server
Running other java apps.

Read full topic

item.title: Environmental variables
item.dc:creator: @Linksbro Linksbro
item.description:
@Linksbro wrote:

Manual Compiler for those who don’t know how to set Environment Varibles

Download any version of JDK,

Open a CMD and set your path by typing

path C:\program files\java\JDK1.6.0_07\bin;

**NOTE Insert your version of JDK in that text

Set your folder path

cd C:\Figmentscape

**NOTE Replace with what your folder path is

Your CMD should now look like,

C:\Figmentscape>

Now type,
javac *.java

This should compile, and then type,
java server

Which should run your server.

Fool Proof Compiler guide for the weak.

-Linksbro

Read full topic
